companies.story:
The Journey of BluePine Industries on Shark Tank India

BluePine Industries, founded by Karen D. Thapa and Priyanka Singh, brought authentic Himalayan momos to a larger market. Their innovative frozen momos aimed at preserving taste and quality while making it accessible to all.

The Pitch

The founders sought ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity. They highlighted their unique preservation techniques and growing demand.

The Investment Deal

After deliberation, Ashneer Grover, Vineeta Singh, and Aman Gupta offered ₹75 lakhs for 16% equity.

Post Shark Tank Growth

The brand expanded its distribution channels, securing deals with major retailers and scaling production.

companies.product: Renting e-bike for mobility in private spaces
companies.story:
The Journey of Booz Scooters on Shark Tank India

Nikhil Vora and Sahil Vora introduced Booz Scooters, a solution for e-bike rentals in private spaces like resorts and townships.

The Pitch

The founders asked for ₹40 lakhs for 15% equity, showcasing their sustainable transportation model.

The Investment Deal

Ashneer Grover and Vineeta Singh saw potential and negotiated a final deal of ₹40 lakhs for 50% equity.

Post Shark Tank Growth

The investment allowed Booz Scooters to expand to multiple cities and improve their technology.

Heart Up My Sleeves on Shark Tank India

Founded by Riya Khattar, Heart Up My Sleeves is a unique fashion brand that offers detachable sleeves to add a stylish touch to any outfit.

The Pitch

Riya impressed the Sharks with her innovative idea and requested ₹25 lakhs for 10% equity. Her brand gained attention for offering sustainable fashion solutions.

The Investment Deal

Anupam Mittal saw potential in the idea and offered ₹25 lakhs for 30% equity.

Post Shark Tank Growth

With Anupam’s support, the brand expanded its online presence and product range.

Tagz Foods on Shark Tank India

Tagz Foods, founded by Anish Basu Roy and Sagar Bisen, brings a healthier alternative to traditional chips using innovative techniques.

The Pitch

They sought ₹70 lakhs for 1% equity to expand their brand and reach more consumers.

The Investment Deal

Their healthy snacks attracted Ashneer Grover, Aman Gupta, and Peyush Bansal, who invested ₹70 lakhs for 2.75% equity.

Post Shark Tank Growth

Tagz Foods saw a huge boost in sales and distribution.

The Journey of Head and Heart on Shark Tank India

Head and Heart is an innovative educational platform that offers brain development courses for students. Founded by Surabhi Srivastava, the company aims to enhance cognitive abilities through structured learning methods.

The Pitch

During their pitch on Shark Tank India, the founder sought ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity. Despite a well-presented pitch, the sharks decided not to invest.

Post Shark Tank Journey

Although the company did not secure a deal, it gained significant visibility and continues to grow, reaching more students nationwide.

The Journey of Agri Tourism on Shark Tank India

Agri Tourism, founded by Pandurang Taware, promotes rural tourism in India. The initiative aims to provide an authentic farm experience to visitors while supporting local farmers.

The Pitch

Seeking ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity, the founder presented his vision for rural tourism. Despite the strong concept, no investment was made.

Growth After Shark Tank

Following the show, Agri Tourism gained media attention and continued expanding its reach, promoting eco-friendly tourism.

The Journey of qZense Labs on Shark Tank India

qZense Labs, founded by Sanjoth Rai and Sona Mazumdar, is a tech-driven company developing IoT-based food freshness detectors to ensure food safety.

The Pitch

The team sought ₹1 crore for 0.25% equity, presenting their advanced sensor technology for detecting food freshness. However, they did not secure an investment.

Future Prospects

Despite not getting a deal, qZense Labs continues to refine its technology, collaborating with food industries to enhance quality assurance.

The Journey of Peeschute on Shark Tank India

Peeschute, founded by Sidharth Gupta, offers a revolutionary disposable urine bag that ensures hygiene and convenience.

companies.final_equity: ₹20 lakhs for 15% equity and ₹30 lakhs debt

companies.story: The Journey of CosIQ on Shark Tank India CosIQ is a skincare brand that uses intelligent formulations to provide scientifically-backed skincare solutions. Founded by Angad Ahuja and Kanika Ahuja, the brand aims to revolutionize the skincare industry. The Pitch The founders asked for ₹50 lakhs for 7% equity, impressing the sharks with their innovative approach. They secured a deal of ₹50 lakhs for 25% equity. Growth After Shark Tank Since the show, CosIQ has expanded its product line and gained significant traction in the market.

The Journey of JhaJi Achaar on Shark Tank India JhaJi Achaar, founded by Kalpana Jha and Uma Jha, specializes in traditional homemade pickles with authentic flavors. The Pitch The founders asked for ₹50 lakhs for 10% equity but did not secure an investment. Impact After Shark Tank Despite not getting a deal, JhaJi Achaar saw a massive increase in sales due to the exposure on the show.

The Journey of Bummer on Shark Tank India Bummer, founded by Sulay Lavsi, offers premium, sustainable underwear designed for comfort and style. The Pitch Asking for ₹75 lakhs for 4% equity, the brand negotiated a deal of ₹75 lakhs for 7.5% equity. Success After Shark Tank Bummer has since expanded its reach and become a well-known name in the fashion industry.

investors: Aman Gupta, Anupam Mittal, Ashneer Grover, Peyush Bansal
companies.story: The Journey of Revamp Moto on Shark Tank India Revamp Moto, founded by Jayesh Tope and Pritesh Mahajan, creates electric bikes designed for efficiency and sustainability. The Pitch The founders sought ₹1 crore for 1% equity and secured a deal for ₹1 crore for 1.5% equity. Expanding the Business After Shark Tank, Revamp Moto accelerated its production and gained significant investor interest.

The Journey of Hungry Heads on Shark Tank India Hungry Heads, founded by Parimal Sethia, is a restaurant famous for serving 80 varieties of Maggi dishes. The Pitch Asking for ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity, the startup did not secure a deal. Post Shark Tank Despite no deal, the brand gained massive popularity and expanded its customer base.

The Journey of Shrawani Engineers on Shark Tank India Founded by Shrawani Jadhav, the company introduced an innovative belly button shaper device. The Pitch Asked for ₹10 lakhs for 20% equity but did not receive an investment. Future Growth Though not funded, the exposure helped the product gain visibility in the market.

investors: Aman Gupta, Ashneer Grover, Peyush Bansal, Vineeta Singh
companies.story: The Journey of Skippi Pops on Shark Tank India Founded by Ravi Kabra and Anuja Kabra, Skippi Pops reintroduced ice pops in a healthier format. The Pitch They secured a deal of ₹1 crore for 15% equity. Success Story Post Shark Tank, Skippi Pops became a household name and expanded nationwide.

The Journey of Menstrupedia on Shark Tank India Menstrupedia, by Aditi Gupta and Tuhin Paul, promotes menstrual awareness through comics. The Pitch They received a deal for ₹50 lakhs for 20% equity from Namita Thapar. Impact After the Show The platform expanded its reach and educational initiatives.

The Journey of Hecoll on Shark Tank India Founded by Akshay Nand, Hecoll creates pollution-resistant sustainable fabrics. The Pitch They asked for ₹1 crore for 1% equity but did not receive an investment. After Shark Tank Despite no deal, Hecoll continues to innovate in sustainable textiles.

investors: Peyush Bansal, Namita Thapar, Aman Gupta
companies.story: The Journey of Raising Superstars on Shark Tank India Founded by Varchasva Khandelwal and Kunal Chawla, Raising Superstars is a revolutionary child development app. The Pitch They secured a deal of ₹1 crore for 4% equity. Post Shark Tank The app witnessed a surge in users and expanded its reach in the parenting segment.

The Journey of Torchit on Shark Tank India Hunny Bhagchandani introduced assistive technology for the visually impaired. The Pitch Despite an innovative concept, they did not secure a deal. After Shark Tank The exposure helped Torchit gain traction in the assistive tech industry.

The Journey of La Kheer Deli on Shark Tank India Shantanu Gawande brought a modern twist to the traditional Indian dessert, Kheer. The Pitch They secured a deal for ₹50 lakhs for 7.5% equity. Success After Shark Tank The brand expanded to new cities and gained loyal customers.

investors: Ashneer Grover, Aman Gupta, Vineeta Singh
companies.story: The Journey of Beyond Snack on Shark Tank India Founded by Shiv Ramachandran, Beyond Snack aims to provide authentic and hygienic Kerala banana chips. The Pitch They successfully secured ₹50 lakhs for 2.5% equity. Success Story Post Shark Tank, Beyond Snack expanded its reach across India and gained popularity in retail stores.

The Journey of Vivalyf Innovations on Shark Tank India Founded by Raman Talwar, the startup developed a painless diabetes testing machine. The Pitch They asked for ₹56 lakhs for 7.5% equity, but the counteroffer was ₹56 lakhs for 33.33% equity, which they declined. Future Growth Despite no deal, the company continues to innovate and expand its reach.

The Journey of Motion Breeze on Shark Tank India Founded by Varun Mittal, Motion Breeze focuses on smart electric motorcycles for a sustainable future. The Pitch They sought ₹30 lakhs for 3% equity, but the counteroffer was ₹30 lakhs for 6% equity, which was declined. Post Shark Tank Though no deal was secured, the startup gained visibility and customer interest.

The Journey of Altor on Shark Tank India Founded by Aishwarya Pillai, Altor develops smart helmets to enhance rider safety. The Pitch They requested ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity, but the counteroffer was ₹50 lakhs for 7% equity, which they did not accept. Impact After the Show Despite no investment, Altor continues to grow and refine its smart helmet technology.

The Journey of Ariro on Shark Tank India Ariro, founded by Vasanth Kamath and Nisha Kamath, specializes in eco-friendly wooden toys. The Pitch They secured an investment of ₹50 lakhs for 10% equity from Peyush Bansal. Impact The brand gained national recognition and expanded its sustainable toy line.

The Journey of Kabira Handmade on Shark Tank India Founded by Kabir Dixit, Kabira Handmade produces organic and healthy cooking oils. The Pitch Despite not securing a deal, the startup gained significant brand awareness. Future Prospects Kabira Handmade continues to grow in the organic food space.

investors: Aman Gupta, Peyush Bansal, Namita Thapar
companies.story: The Journey of Nuutjob on Shark Tank India Nuutjob, founded by Ananya Wadhawan and Anushree Maloo, focuses on male hygiene products. The Pitch They secured ₹25 lakhs for 20% equity. Post Shark Tank The brand has expanded its product line and awareness in men’s hygiene.

The Journey of Meatyour on Shark Tank India Founded by Rohan Kumar, Meatyour aims to provide high-quality eggs. The Pitch Despite offering ₹30 lakhs for 5% equity, no deal was made. Future Growth The company continues to expand its reach in the poultry industry.

EventBeep, founded by Sanjay Kumar, is a student community app that helps students connect and collaborate. Despite asking ₹30 lakhs for 2% equity, Peyush Bansal offered ₹30 lakhs for 3% equity, which was accepted.
Gopal Gandhi pitched Gopal's 56, a fiber-rich ice cream brand. Despite a bold ask of ₹300 crores for 25% equity, no deal was made, but the brand continues to expand.
ARRCOAT Surface Textures, founded by Aman Singhal, focuses on innovative wall-building solutions. Despite seeking ₹50 lakhs for 5% equity, no deal was secured, but the company continues to thrive.
Farda, founded by Niti Singhal, is a brand for customized streetwear. Seeking ₹30 lakhs for 10% equity, she struck a deal with Anupam Mittal and Peyush Bansal for ₹30 lakhs at 20% equity.
Auli Lifestyle, founded by Aishwarya Biswas, specializes in organic beauty products. Seeking ₹75 lakhs for 4% equity, she received an offer of ₹75 lakhs for 15% equity but did not accept the deal.

The Journey of SweeDesi on Shark Tank India. Founded by Priyanka Agrawal, SweeDesi offers traditional Indian sweets with a modern touch. Despite requesting ₹40 lakhs for 3% equity, no deal was secured. The company continues to grow in the dessert industry.

The Journey of LOKA on Shark Tank India. Founded by Krishnan Sunderarajan, LOKA is an innovative metaverse application. Initially seeking ₹40 lakhs for 5% equity, the final deal was closed at ₹40 lakhs for 24% equity.

The Journey of Annie on Shark Tank India. Founded by Saif Shaikh, Annie is a Braille literary device designed to aid visually impaired individuals. Seeking ₹30 lakhs for 0.5% equity, the company secured ₹1.05 crore for 3% equity.

The Journey of Caragreen on Shark Tank India. Founded by Sandeep Patel, Caragreen specializes in eco-friendly boxes. The pitch sought ₹50 lakhs for 10% equity but did not receive a deal. The company continues its mission in sustainable packaging.

The Journey of The Yarn Bazaar on Shark Tank India. Founded by Pratik Gadia, the company provides a B2B marketplace for yarn trading. Seeking ₹50 lakhs for 2% equity, they secured ₹1 crore for 10% equity.

The Journey of The Renal Project on Shark Tank India. Founded by Shashank Moddhia, The Renal Project provides home dialysis treatments. Initially seeking ₹1 crore for 3% equity, they secured a deal at ₹1 crore for 6% equity.
Morikko Pure Foods aims to provide healthy and nutritious snacks. Despite an ask of ₹1 crore for 3% equity, no deal was finalized.
Good Good Piggy Bank, an educational fintech platform, pitched for ₹45 lakhs at 5% equity but didn't secure a deal.
Hammer Lifestyle offers smart audio products. Initially seeking ₹30 lakhs for 3% equity, Aman Gupta invested ₹1 crore for 40% equity.

companies.final_equity: ₹25 lakhs for 25% equity and ₹25 lakhs debt
companies.story: PNT Robotics, specializing in automation solutions, proposed ₹50 lakhs for 4% equity but secured ₹25 lakhs for 25% equity and ₹25 lakhs in debt.
Cocofit, founded by Yeshwanth Nag, is a coconut-based beverage franchise. Despite pitching ₹5 for 5% equity, no deal was made.
